success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant creates a weekly recurring one-on-one meeting series with Lisa via create_recurring_meeting with 30-minute duration.

task.objective: Set up a weekly one-on-one meeting with Lisa

injected_behaviors.instructions: The user wants to set up a weekly meeting with Lisa. They prefer Friday afternoons.

persona.name: Jordan Miles
persona.bio: Jordan Miles teaches fourth grade and loves turning lessons into games that keep students moving and laughing. Weekends are for brunch with friends, planning field trips, and catching up on travel deals during school breaks.
persona.writing_style: Warm energy, mix of caps/lowercase, exclamation marks, casual
sample_messages: weather looks good for saturday! let's lock in that zoo field trip
Does the park allow groups of 25 kids or do we need a permit?
perfect!! forwarding this to the other teachers now

messages.output_raw: hey! i wanna set up a weekly 1:1 meeting with someone on my team, can you help me get that on the calendar?

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need details before tools. Ask concise clarifying Qs: attendee email, duration, day/time, start date, end condition, location/title, timezone. Then will call find_available_recurring_slots, then create_recurring_meeting.<think>
I need to gather all the key scheduling details and preferences from the user before I can search availability or create a recurring meeting. Specifically, I need the teammate’s email, time/day preferences, duration, start date, end condition, timezone, and location/title. Once I have those, I can use the recurring availability tool to propose options, then create the recurring meeting with the chosen slot. For now, I should ask focused questions to move directly toward a schedulable setup.
</think>
<plan>
1. Ask for the essential details about the 1:1 (attendee, duration, preferred day/time, start date, end condition, timezone, and location).
2. Once provided, find recurring slots that work for both attendees.
3. Propose one or two concrete options and confirm the user’s choice.
4. Create the recurring meeting in the calendar and confirm details back to the user.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can set that up. I just need a few details:

1) Who is it with? (their email address)
2) How long should each 1:1 be? (e.g., 30 or 60 minutes)
3) What’s your preferred time and day of the week? (e.g., Tuesdays at 3:00–3:30 PM)
4) When should the series start? (first date)
5) When should it end — or should it be ongoing for now? (e.g., end after 6 months or 10 occurrences)
6) What time zone should I use?
7) Location: a meeting room, “Zoom/Teams”, or another link?
8) What title/description would you like? (e.g., “Weekly 1:1 with Alex”)

Share whatever you know, and I’ll fill in reasonable defaults for anything you’re unsure about.</action>

action_structured.text:
I can set that up. I just need a few details:

1) Who is it with? (their email address)
2) How long should each 1:1 be? (e.g., 30 or 60 minutes)
3) What’s your preferred time and day of the week? (e.g., Tuesdays at 3:00–3:30 PM)
4) When should the series start? (first date)
5) When should it end — or should it be ongoing for now? (e.g., end after 6 months or 10 occurrences)
6) What time zone should I use?
7) Location: a meeting room, “Zoom/Teams”, or another link?
8) What title/description would you like? (e.g., “Weekly 1:1 with Alex”)

Share whatever you know, and I’ll fill in reasonable defaults for anything you’re unsure about.

messages.output_raw:
awesome yes!!  

1) it’s with lisa – her email is lisa.park@mpls.k12.mn.us  
2) 30 minutes  
3) friday afternoons work best for me, like around 2:30 pm if that’s free  
4) let’s start this coming friday  
5) let’s just make it ongoing for now  
6) time zone is central (CT)  
7) location: let’s put it as a google meet  
8) title: “Weekly 1:1 – Jordan & Lisa”  

if 2:30 is not open just grab the closest friday afternoon time that works 👍

Also need clarification on “ongoing” end condition (date vs occurrences) because tool requires recurrence_end. So ask for own email and how long to set (e.g., 1 year). No tool call now.

<plan>
1. Clarify your email address to add you as an attendee.
2. Confirm which “this coming Friday” date you mean and how long “ongoing” should run (e.g., through a specific date).
3. Once clarified, search for a weekly Friday-afternoon slot near 2:30 PM that works for both of you.
4. Create the recurring meeting with a Google Meet link and confirm the final schedule back to you.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can set this up, just need two quick clarifications so I don’t guess:

1) What email address should I use for you as an attendee?  
2) When you say “this coming Friday,” do you mean Friday of this week on the calendar right now? And how long should “ongoing” be in the calendar—e.g., run through the end of this school year, through a specific date, or for the next 12 months?

Once I have your email and the end date/period, I’ll find the closest available Friday around 2:30 PM CT that works for both of you, then create the recurring Google Meet series titled “Weekly 1:1 – Jordan & Lisa.”</action>

action_structured.text:
I can set this up, just need two quick clarifications so I don’t guess:

1) What email address should I use for you as an attendee?  
2) When you say “this coming Friday,” do you mean Friday of this week on the calendar right now? And how long should “ongoing” be in the calendar—e.g., run through the end of this school year, through a specific date, or for the next 12 months?

Once I have your email and the end date/period, I’ll find the closest available Friday around 2:30 PM CT that works for both of you, then create the recurring Google Meet series titled “Weekly 1:1 – Jordan & Lisa.”
